definition: abbr. for 青海[Qing1 hai3], Qinghai Province

sentences.english: The bunch of teenagers who spend their afternoons smoking in the local railway station?
sentences.chinese: 一羣整個下午都在本地火車站抽菸的小青年？

sentences.english: American fashion stylists all talk like Californian teenagers.
sentences.chinese: 美國時尚設計師們的談吐就像加州的小青年。

sentences.english: However, I have no desire to force refused to small youth.
sentences.chinese: 但是，我又沒有力量拒絕小青年的慾望。

sentences.english: He was attacked by a gang of youths.
sentences.chinese: 他遭到了一幫小青年的襲擊。

sentences.english: A young man attached himself to me at the party and I couldn't get rid of him.
sentences.chinese: 聚會中有個小青年總纏著我，我也甩不開他。

sentences.english: The fictional young lovers at the street curbs were still fighting as if it were life and death for trivial things.
sentences.chinese: 路邊親親我我戀愛的小青年們爲了一點小事要死要活。

sentences.english: Little young to be my wonderful, hard drive, loyalty pay off.
sentences.chinese: 小青年待我極好，開車賣力，交帳忠誠。

definition: erhua variant of 小伙[xiao3 huo3]
angry youth/positive term used to describe young Chinese with extreme nationalistic tendencies/see also 糞青|粪青[fen4 qing1]
erhua variant of 女孩[nu:3 hai2]
eldest of father's younger brothers/uncle (term used to address a man about the age of one's father)
(PRC) flow of people from the countryside into the cities/rural migrant without definite prospects/drifter
erhua variant of 爺們|爷们[ye2 men5]
